title: General Motors to Invest $1.4B in Arlington Assembly Plant - Analyst Blog
text:
Content preferences Done 
General Motors Company GM announced plans to invest $1.4 billion in the Arlington Assembly Plant located in Texas. This is the largest investment in a single plant by the automaker in the U.S. this year.General Motors stated that it will invest in the plant to produce high-quality full-size SUVs at a competitive rate. The automaker will reconfigure the plant with a new paint shop and body shop and will also upgrade the general assembly area. The company will start the construction work this summer and expects to complete the process in the next three years. General Motors also clarified that the construction work will not affect the production schedules for Chevrolet Tahoes and Suburbans, GMC Yukons and Yukon XLs and Cadillac Escalades.General Motors aims to manufacture and supply the best SUVs in the market. Since 2011, the company has invested $2 billion in the Arlington Assembly Plant. The plant, which is more than 60 years old, produced its 10 millionth vehicle this year.General Motors is focused on making investments in innovative technologies and vehicles, which should provide sustained growth while maximizing shareholdersâ€™ value. In Apr 2015, the company announced plans of putting in $5.4 billion for the improvement of its plants in the U.S. over the next three years. The investment in the Arlington Assembly Plant is part of this larger strategy. As of now, the company has made an investment proposal of approximately $4.5 billion. Plans for the remaining $900 million are expected to be announced by the end of this year.Post bankruptcy since Jun 2009, General Motors has announced an investment of $17.8 billion in U.S. facilities. Of this, around $12.4 billion has been planned since the 2011 UAW-GM National Agreement. With the latest investment, the automaker has created 6,250 new positions and secured the jobs of around 20,700 other workers.General Motors is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock. Better-ranked stocks in the auto industry include Ford Motor Co. F, Magna International Inc. MGA and PACCAR Inc.
